image.altText: Police block roads on a deserted street at night

props.synopsis: Police have shot dead a 16-year-old boy who stabbed a member of the public, saying the teenager was "radicalised" online.

title.children: Police shoot dead 'radicalised' 16yo armed with a knife in WA

image.altText: A camera sits high above a window on a business

props.synopsis: CCTV has captured the horror that unfolded when a knife-wielding teen was shot dead by WA police in a Bunnings car park.

title.children: This camera captured the horror that unfolded when a knife-wielding teen was shot dead by police

image.altText: Shopping strip with police tape in foreground and two policemen behind it

props.synopsis: Police say there was no one in the cafe when a dark-coloured sedan pulled up and fired bullets through the windows.

title.children: Police are investigating shots fired at a cafe in Melbourne's north-east

image.altText: Four people in orange SES jackets, pants and helmets walk down a residential street in formation.

props.synopsis: Drivers stop on a busy Melbourne street to help two men attacked in a fatal incident in the suburb of Ormond.

title.children: Melbourne police search for pair who fled scene after man killed in city's south-east

image.altText: A teacher and nursing student in a prac hospital room.

props.synopsis: The government announces a new $319 weekly practical payment to ease the financial strain of unpaid student placements.

title.children: Government unveils funding lifeline for cash-strapped uni students doing mandatory unpaid placements

image.altText: German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock and Australian Foreign Affairs Minister Penny Wong.

props.synopsis: Germany's foreign minister tells 7.30 her nation was caught out being over-reliant on Russian oil and gas and has urged nations worldwide not to do the same in regards to China.

title.children: 'Warned us': Germany's foreign minister speaks of deep Russia trade regret

image.altText: Lincoln McCarthy lays on the ground holding his knee

props.synopsis: The Lions lose one player in the warm-up, and another three in the first half in injury chaos at the Gabba, while Luke Beveridge voices his concerns for Tom Liberatore's health after a scary incident.

title.children: Lions down sorry Suns despite injury carnage in QClash, while Dogs coach concerned for Libba

image.altText: An older man with white hair looks serious as he stands in front of a blue and white Israeli flag.

props.synopsis: The decision is an escalation of Israel's long-running feud with Al Jazeera, which it accuses of bias, and also threatens to heighten tensions with Qatar, which owns the channel.

title.children: Israel orders Al Jazeera to close its offices in Israel, as Netanyahu labels it an 'incitement channel'

image.altText: An older middle-aged man in a blue bulletproof vests walks in the desert near a bright yellow ambulance and two soldiers.

props.synopsis: The attack disrupted critical shipments of food and other humanitarian aid into Gaza, and dealt a new blow to ongoing ceasefire efforts mediated by Egypt and Qatar.

title.children: Hamas attacks Israel-Gaza border crossing, prompting Israel to halt aid deliveries

image.altText: Teenage girl smiles showing face and open hands in traditional body paint.

props.synopsis: In the bush, 'burbs and on country, these teenagers are fighting a mental health crisis. Spoiler alert: They're winning.

title.children: Generation overwhelmed: These kids fought back against a national health crisis — and won

image.altText: Jaci Armstrong sits on her lounge in her living room hugging her black guide dog

props.synopsis: Jaci Armstrong and her guide dog, Bess, often use rideshare apps and taxis to get around, but it's never simple. The NSW government hopes a massive increase to the fines for refusing service will end the discrimination.

title.children: 'No you can't get in': Jaci has been left in tears by Sydney drivers refusing to take her guide dog

image.altText: Mortar board sitting on a pile of money

props.synopsis: Millions of Australians with student loans will have hundreds of dollars wiped from their HECS debts as the federal government rolls out its plans for cost-of-living relief in the upcoming budget.

title.children: HECS changes to see $3 billion in student debt 'wiped out'

image.altText: Two men stand together with their arms around each other

props.synopsis: Mexico's north-west coast is a mecca for surfers despite the dangers that lurk on back roads. When two Australians and an American went missing, their loved ones had to piece together the puzzle of their disappearance.

title.children: Australian brothers likely shot during robbery gone wrong in Mexico, authorities say

image.altText: A shot of a rural property with police cars from above.

props.synopsis: Police have kept an active crime scene in Mount Mee, north of Brisbane, since Wednesday night, with divers and other specialist teams called in.

title.children: Man and woman charged with murder, torture over death of man allegedly held on rural property for three days

image.altText: a close up photo of a sign that says how many more women

props.synopsis: Federal Minister for Women Katy Gallagher defends the government's eligibility criteria for its leaving violence payment and says states and territories have only filled 30 frontline gendered violence roles ahead of a target to fill 352.

title.children: Recruitment issues to blame for only 30 of the 500 gender violence frontline jobs being filled, minister says

image.altText: A blurry image of people queueing to enter a Centrelink office to apply for unemployment benefits.

props.synopsis: The Economic Inclusion Advisory Committee says Australia's unemployment benefits are woefully inadequate, and Australia sticks out internationally.

title.children: Why are Australia's unemployment payments so inadequate? Experts say they have been deteriorating for decades

image.altText: AFL footballer Sam Draper, with his head down, walking off the field after a defeat

props.synopsis: Essendon coach Brad Scott says ruckman Sam Draper still has plenty of scope to express his personality and be funny — just not at the expense of an opposition coach.

title.children: Draper's 'disrespectful' comments draw ire of his own coach

image.altText: Casey Badger talks to Aiden Sezer

props.synopsis: Cronulla-Sutherland came from behind to beat St George Illawarra 20-10 at a sodden Shark Park after the Knights edged the Warriors 14-8 at Newcastle.

title.children: Wests Tigers halfback cops massive ban as Sharks, Knights record soggy victories

image.altText: Johann Hari

props.synopsis: Two days after injecting himself with Ozempic, writer Johann Hari woke up feeling something he'd never felt before — not hungry. But is the diabetes drug the magic cure for obesity some people think it is?

title.children: Ozempic changed Johann Hari's life. But was it worth it?

props.synopsis: Three women who have never had sex share their experiences of dating and intimacy, and how they can sometimes feel alone and adrift on a vast sea of gyrating hips and grinding bodies.

title.children: Jo is 42 and has never had sex. She regrets that no-one has enjoyed her body

image.altText: Close up photo of a teenage girl in front of a wall

props.synopsis: At this regional youth centre, vaping has outstripped alcohol and cannabis as the most common addiction. These teenagers tell us how they managed to quit.

title.children: For Isabella and friends, the key to quitting vaping comes from peer support

image.altText: Three women sitting on a grey bench wearing blue jeans.

props.synopsis: It can feel hopeless not knowing how to help a friend or loved one who might be experiencing domestic violence. But friends and family can play a huge role in supporting and helping them get to safety. Here is the advice from Aboriginal matriarchs with a wide range of expertise.

title.children: 'Don't be bossy': What to say to a friend who tells you they're experiencing DV

image.altText: A concrete wall on a suburban block

props.synopsis: A prize-winning Victorian architect responsible for major community housing projects has been charged with carrying out illegal building work on her own property, and allegedly assaulting a neighbour with a plastic pipe.

title.children: Prize-winning architect charged with illegal building work at Melbourne home

image.altText: A lady with blonde hair and wearing a vest stands in front of a jeep with the words 'Jurassic Park" on it.

props.synopsis: Bringing the world of genetically engineered dinosaurs to life for a low-cost remake is not an easy task, but a team of volunteers is making it happen.

title.children: They started with six people wanting to remake Jurassic Park. Now there's about 100 people on the film credits

image.altText: A woman in a red jumper and blue jeans, holding a basket, tries to avoid being 'tagged' by another woman in a supermarket.

props.synopsis: In Longreach, a group of friends spend a month each year trying to tag each other. In the spirit of fun, I decided to join in the game.

title.children: Why an annual month-long game of tag sparks joy for the adults in this small outback town

image.altText: Torrie Lewis

props.synopsis: Torrie Lewis anchors Australia's 4x100m relay team to a national record in the Bahamas, securing an automatic spot at the Paris Olympics.

title.children: Aussie sprinters smash national record to secure a place in the 4x100m at the Olympics

image.altText: Sailing1

props.synopsis: Stunning vision shows the crew of a US F50 catamaran being thrown through the air after their vessel capsized during the pre-race in Bermuda.

title.children: Spectacular footage shows US catamaran capsizing as crew are flung through the air

image.altText: A photo of a rocky mountain range with the affirmation: 'You can do it! But you probably won't.'

props.synopsis: Dave Tarnowski's disappointing affirmations are making millions on Instagram laugh. But his point is serious: As a man who has lived with depression and anxiety his entire life, he wants to strip stigma from mental illness and make people feel seen.

title.children: His disappointing affirmations make millions laugh, but Dave Tarnowksi has serious stuff to say about mental illness

image.altText: A woman with long hair smiling in a red fleece, navy leggings and a hiking pack, with a mountain range and ocean behind her.

props.synopsis: A quick scroll through Laura Waddell’s social media feeds reveals she’s learnt a lot on her many hikes — and these treks are often multi-day solo adventures.

title.children: Have you ever tried hiking alone? Laura says there's a lot to gain from a solitary trek

image.altText: An image of a scoreboard.

props.synopsis: The Fitzroy Community Club thrashed the Elizabeth Football Club at the round four game in Adelaide's north on Saturday, scoring 82 goals and 24 behinds.

title.children: Local football team scores remarkable 516-0 win in Adelaide Footy League game

image.altText: US president Joe Biden descends the steps of Air Force One.

props.synopsis: National Security Council spokesman John Kirby has reassured Japanese allies that the president's remarks were only about conveying the US as "a nation of immigrants".

title.children: Tokyo labels Biden's Japan remarks 'unfortunate' following 'xenophobic' comment

image.altText: A zebra with black and white stripes, looking sideways with an eye that looks teary, standing inside a trailer

props.synopsis: Authorities corral an escaped zebra almost a week after it and three others ran out of a trailer on its way from Seattle, Washington to Montana.

title.children: Shug the zebra captured after gallivanting around US state for days

image.altText: F1 driver Oscar Piastri, wearing a cap, in his racing suit, speaking to someone on the pit lane

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri will start the race alongside his McLaren teammate Lando Norris who qualified fifth, while fellow Aussie Daniel Ricciardo will start from the back of the grid.

title.children: 'Pleased' Piastri starts sixth in Miami, Max Verstappen on pole

image.altText: Tom Gleeson on the set of Hard Quiz gesturing behind him with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Back again, I see! I'd say I'm impressed but we both know it takes more than that. Get ready to play, HARD.

title.children: Do you like your Sunday coffee with a side of shame? Try this quiz

image.altText: A woman looking at a storyboard about her great-grandfather.

props.synopsis: Family ties bind as memorial unveiled to honour WA detectives murdered by gold thieves in 1920s.

title.children: Until two months ago, Kathryn had no idea that her great-grandfather was a convicted murderer
